duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide individual and group counseling sessions to address interpersonal or family issues that interfere with school performance, including crisis intervention consultation and/or family therapy as needed.
Maintain all required paperwork including but not limited to communication logs and meticulous notes regarding all services provided to students.
Conduct interviews with students, family members, and school personnel to gather information required to assess student social, emotional, and behavioral adjustment to school and the community.
Maintain regular contact with students’ parents/guardians to inform them of student’s progress, areas of difficulties, and any changes or situations in home life that may affect school performance.
Develop and update Individualized Education Plans (IEP) and Behavior Intervention Plans (BIP) as needed in adherence to the company, school, state, and federal regulations and procedure.
Attend and participate in IEP team meetings, facilitating at the discretion of the school districts.
Collaborate with education and social services professionals (for example wrap-around, probation officers, court systems) to develop appropriate agency services for students and their families.
Provide case management functions for students, including coordination of parent meetings, emergency transportation requests, and coordination with therapists outside the school setting.

Collaborate and consult with teachers, parents/guardians, district personnel, and service providers to find effective solutions to learning and behavior problems and maintain effective public relations.
Ensure the use of positive social skill teaching methods by conducting monthly direct observation of classroom staff’s implementation of IEP goals and/or Behavior Intervention Plans/Treatment Plans.
Provide guidance, consultation, and assistance to teachers in the development of classroom schedules, maintenance of student data systems, and facilitation of student transition plans.

Assess student progress through consistent review of classroom data collection and recording systems and provide applicable training and guidance to classroom staff accordingly in addressing student behavioral needs.
Conduct crisis assessments and contact the appropriate authorities if needed to ensure that emergency intervention is provided to students.
Keep up to date with research-based practices and developments in the subject area.
Respond constructively to formal and informal feedback.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree or higher in social work or related field. Master's degree in social work preferred. Licensed clinical social worker credentials. Prior social work experience in an education program setting.
